description.value: This code system defines a set of codes for NDH Healthcare Service Category used in the National Directory of Healthcare Providers and Services (NDH).

definition.value: Services related to the promotion of mental health, resilience and wellbeing; the treatment of mental and substance use disorders; and the support of those who experience and/or are in recovery from these conditions, along with their families and communities.
Services related to the study, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the teeth, gums, and mouth.
Health care consumables or equipments supplied to patients

Health care services rendered within a designated emergency care facility, for point-in-time evaluation and/or treatment any medical condition such that a prudent layperson possessing an average knowledge of medicine and health, believes that immediate unscheduled medical care is required.

Health care services provided by a collective of medical practitioners, typically physicians, who work together to deliver coordinated medical care. This group focuses on medical treatment and does not vision or dental services.

Health care services delivered to patients within their residence rather than a clinical setting; usually provided by nurses, home health aides, and other professionals on a regularly scheduled visit.
Health care services rendered within a hospital or other inpatient setting providng patient treatment with specialzed medical and nursing staff and medical equipment.
Pathology and laboratory testing on clinical specimenst to obtain informaion about the health of a paeint to aid in diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease.
Health care services rendered in an outpatient facility, e.g. medical procedures, surgeries, etc.
Individual healthcare services rendered by a licensed medical professional, such as a physician or nurse, focusing on general medical care rather than specialized fields like dentistry or vision.
Services related to the storage, compounding, dispensing and sale of drugs.
Services related to the transportation of patients to and from a healthcare facility, or programs related to transportation insecurity.
Unscheduled health care services which provide for point-in-time evaluation or treatment of a non-life-threatening medical condition.
Services related to the study, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the eyes.
Services or programs related to education, including health literacy, health education, and health promotion (stress management, smoking cessation, etc.)
Services or programs related to employment assistance.
Services or programs related to financial insecurity, material hardship, or medical cost burden.
Services or programs related to food insecurity or inadequate nutrition.
Services or programs related to housing instability, inadequate housing, or homelessness.
Services or programs related to personal safety, including intimate partner violence, elder abuse, sexual violence, and child abuse and neglect.
Services or programs related to social isolation or social connection.
